required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate a 13-valent Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine in Infants.
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Active-Controlled, Double-blind Trial Evaluating the Safety, Tolerability, and Immunogenicity of a 13-valent Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine in Healthy Infants Given With Routine Pediatric Vaccinations in Spain

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety, tolerability and immunogenicity of a 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate (13vPnC) vaccine compared to Prevenar (7vPnC), when given concomitantly with routine pediatric vaccinations in Spain.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Predefined Meningococcal C Serum Bactericidal Assay (SBA) Titer of ≥ 1:8, and a Predefined Antibody Level for Diphtheria in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After 2-doses of the Infant Series
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after 2-doses of the infant series (5 months of age)
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving predefined antibody threshold levels; greater than or equal to (≥) 1:8 for meningococcal C SBA titer and ≥ 0.10 or >=0.01 International Units Per Milliliter (IU/mL) for diphtheria along with the corresponding 95% Confidence Interval (CI) are presented.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of Meningococcal C in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After 2-doses of the Infant Series
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after 2-doses of the infant series (5 months of age)

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration (GMC) for Diphtheria in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After 2-doses of the Infant Series
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after 2-doses of the infant series (5 months of age)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Local Reactions
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day period after each dose
primary_outcome.description: Local reactions were collected using an electronic diary. Tenderness was scaled as Any (tenderness present); Significant (Sig) (present and interfered with limb movement). Swelling and redness were scaled as Any (swelling or redness present); Mild (0.5 centimeters [cm] to 2.0 cm); Moderate (Mod) (2.5 to 7.0 cm); Severe (>7.0 cm). Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Systemic Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day period after each dose
primary_outcome.description: Systemic events (fever [Fv] ≥ 37.5 degrees Celsius [C], fever ≥ 38 C but ≤ 39 C, fever >39 C but ≤ 40 C, fever > 40 C, decreased [Decr] appetite, irritability, increased [Incr] sleep, decreased sleep, hives, use of medication [Med] to treat symptoms [sx], and use of medication to prevent symptoms) were reported using an electronic diary. Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration (GMC) for Serotype-specific Pneumococcal Immunoglobulin G (IgG) Antibody in 13vPnC Group After the Second Dose and After the Third Dose of a 3-Dose Infant Series and After the Toddler Dose
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after infant series dose 2 (at 5 months of age) and dose 3 (at 7 months of age) and one month after the toddler dose (at 16 months of age)
primary_outcome.description: GMC as measured by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes which are present in both 7vPnC and 13vPnC (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (Serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Predefined Antibody Levels for Pertussis, Diphtheria, Tetanus, and Poliovirus in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 3-dose Infant Series and the Toddler Dose
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after the 3-dose infant series (7 months of age) and the toddler dose (16 months of age)
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving predefined antibody threshold levels with the corresponding 95% CI for each concomitant antigen (pertussis antigens including Pertussis Toxoid (PT), Filamentous Haemagglutinin (FHA), and Pertactin (PRN); diphtheria; tetanus; and poliovirus types 1, 2, and 3) are presented.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Titers (GMT) for Poliovirus in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 3-dose Infant Series and the Toddler Dose
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after the 3-dose infant series (7 months of age) and the toddler dose (16 months of age)

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentrations (GMC) for Diphtheria and Tetanus in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 3-dose Infant Series and the Toddler Dose
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after the 3-dose infant series (7 months of age) and the toddler dose (16 months of age)

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentrations (GMC) for Pertussis in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 3-dose Infant Series and the Toddler Dose
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after the 3-dose infant series (7 months of age) and the toddler dose (16 months of age)
primary_outcome.description: GMCs with the corresponding 95% CI for each concomitant antigen pertussis antigens (PT, FHA, PRN, and FIM) as measured by EU/mL are presented.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Antibody Level ≥ 0.35 Microgram Per Milliliter (μg/mL) in 13vPnC Group After the Second Dose and After the Third Dose of a 3-Dose Infant Series and After the Toddler Dose
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after infant series dose 2 (at 5 months of age) and dose 3 (at 7 months of age) and one month after the toddler dose (at 16 months of age)
primary_outcome.description: Percentages of participants achieving World Health Organization (WHO) predefined antibody threshold ≥ 0.35μg/mL along with the corresponding 95% CI for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes, present in both 13vPnC and 7vPnC (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy 2-month-old infants
- Available for the entire study period
Exclusion criteria:
- Previous vaccination with any vaccine before the start of the study
- Known contraindication to vaccination

overall_official.affiliation: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited in Spain from October 2006 to December 2006.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants were enrolled into the study according to inclusion/exclusion criteria without a screening period.

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 milliliter (mL) dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) coadministered with a combination vaccine diphtheria, tetanus, and pertussis (acellular) vaccine (DTPa), hepatitis B virus vaccine (HBV), inactivated poliovirus (IPV), and hemophilus influenza type b (Hib) vaccine (Infanrix hexa) and a meningococcal C conjugate vaccine (Meningitec) at 2 and 4 months. Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 6 months. Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with a combination vaccine measles, mumps, rubella live virus (MMR II) at 12 months. Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with DTPa, IPV, and Hib vaccine (Infanrix-IPV+Hib) and Meningitec at 15 months.

group.title: 7vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 milliliter (mL) dose of 7-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (7vPnC) coadministered with a combination vaccine diphtheria, tetanus, and pertussis (acellular) vaccine (DTPa), hepatitis B virus vaccine (HBV), inactivated poliovirus (IPV), and hemophilus influenza type b (Hib) vaccine (Infanrix hexa) and a meningococcal C conjugate vaccine (Meningitec) at 2 and 4 months. Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 6 months. Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with a combination vaccine measles, mumps, rubella live virus (MMR II) at 12 months. Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with DTPa, IPV, and Hib vaccine (Infanrix-IPV+Hib) and Meningitec at 15 months.

participants_list.participants: 1 randomized to 7vPnC but given 13vPnC vaccine; 1 was withdrawn before receiving 7vPnC vaccine

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Subjects received 1 dose (0.5 mL) of 13vPnC together with 1 dose (0.5 mL) of each of the following concomitant vaccines: Infanrix hexa and Meningitec at 2 and 4 months. At 6 months subjects received 13vPnC and Infanrix hexa. At 12 months subjects received MMR II. At 15 months subjects received 13vPnC and Infanrix-IPV+Hib, Meningitec.

group.title: 7vPnC
group.description: Subjects received 1 dose (0.5 mL) of 7vPnC together with 1 dose (0.5 mL) of each of the following concomitant vaccines: Infanrix hexa and Meningitec at 2 and 4 months. At 6 months subjects received 7vPnC and Infanrix hexa. At 12 months subjects received MMR II. At 15 months subjects received 7vPnC and Infanrix-IPV+Hib, Meningitec.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Predefined Meningococcal C Serum Bactericidal Assay (SBA) Titer of ≥ 1:8, and a Predefined Antibody Level for Diphtheria in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After 2-doses of the Infant Series
outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving predefined antibody threshold levels; greater than or equal to (≥) 1:8 for meningococcal C SBA titer and ≥ 0.10 or >=0.01 International Units Per Milliliter (IU/mL) for diphtheria along with the corresponding 95% Confidence Interval (CI) are presented.
outcome.time_frame: One month after 2-doses of the infant series (5 months of age)
outcome.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with a combination vaccine Infanrix hexa and Meningitec at 2 and 4 months. Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 6 months (infant series). Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with MMR II at 12 months. Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix-IPV+Hib and Meningitec at 15 months (toddler dose).

group.title: 7vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with a combination vaccine Infanrix hexa and Meningitec at 2 and 4 months. Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 6 months (infant series). Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with MMR II at 12 months. Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix-IPV+Hib and Meningitec at 15 months (toddler dose).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Predefined Meningococcal C Serum Bactericidal Assay (SBA) Titer of ≥ 1:8, and a Predefined Antibody Level for Diphtheria in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After 2-doses of the Infant Series
measure.description: Percentage of participants achieving predefined antibody threshold levels; greater than or equal to (≥) 1:8 for meningococcal C SBA titer and ≥ 0.10 or >=0.01 International Units Per Milliliter (IU/mL) for diphtheria along with the corresponding 95% Confidence Interval (CI) are presented.
measure.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

analysis.groups_desc: For Meningococcal C the difference in percentage between the two groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) at ≥ 1:8 threshold was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lowest limit of 2-sided 95% CI for the difference between the 2 groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) greater than (>) -10%.

analysis.groups_desc: For Diphtheria the difference in percentage between the two groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) at ≥ 0.10 IU/mL threshold was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lowest limit of 2-sided 95% CI for the difference between the 2 groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) > -10%.

analysis.groups_desc: For Diphtheria the difference in percentage between the two groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) at ≥ 0.01 IU/mL threshold was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lowest limit of 2-sided 95% CI for the difference between the 2 groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) > -10%.

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of Meningococcal C in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After 2-doses of the Infant Series
outcome.time_frame: One month after 2-doses of the infant series (5 months of age)
outcome.population: The evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with a combination vaccine Infanrix hexa and Meningitec at 2 and 4 months. Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 6 months (infant series). Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with MMR II at 12 months. Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix-IPV+Hib and Meningitec at 15 months(toddler dose).

group.title: 7vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with a combination vaccine Infanrix hexa and Meningitec at 2 and 4 months. Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 6 months (infant series). Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with MMR II at 12 months. Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix-IPV+Hib and Meningitec at 15 months (toddler dose).

measure.title: Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of Meningococcal C in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After 2-doses of the Infant Series
measure.population: The evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

analysis.groups_desc: For Meningococcal C the GMT ratio (13vPnC/7vPnC) was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for immune response induced by Meningitec was declared if the lower bound of the 2-sided, 95% CI for the GMT ratio (13vPnC group/7vPnC group) was >0.5 (2-fold criterion).

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration (GMC) for Diphtheria in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After 2-doses of the Infant Series
outcome.time_frame: One month after 2-doses of the infant series (5 months of age)
outcome.population: The evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with a combination vaccine Infanrix hexa and Meningitec at 2 and 4 months. Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 6 months (infant series). Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with MMR II at 12 months. Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix-IPV+Hib and Meningitec at 15 months (toddler dose).

group.title: 7vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with a combination vaccine Infanrix hexa and Meningitec at 2 and 4 months. Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 6 months (infant series). Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with MMR II at 12 months. Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix-IPV+Hib and Meningitec at 15 months (toddler dose).

measure.title: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration (GMC) for Diphtheria in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After 2-doses of the Infant Series
measure.population: The evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

analysis.groups_desc: For Diphtheria the GMC ratio (13vPnC/7vPnC) was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for immune response induced by Meningitec was declared if the lower bound of the 2-sided, 95% CI for the GMC ratio (13vPnC group/7vPnC group) was >0.5 (2-fold criterion).

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Local Reactions
outcome.description: Local reactions were collected using an electronic diary. Tenderness was scaled as Any (tenderness present); Significant (Sig) (present and interfered with limb movement). Swelling and redness were scaled as Any (swelling or redness present); Mild (0.5 centimeters [cm] to 2.0 cm); Moderate (Mod) (2.5 to 7.0 cm); Severe (>7.0 cm). Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.
outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day period after each dose
outcome.population: The safety population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of vaccine, (n) = number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days.

group.title: 13vPnC Dose 1
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with a combination vaccine Infanrix hexa and Meningitec at 2 months (infant series).

group.title: 7vPnC Dose 1
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with a combination vaccine Infanrix hexa and Meningitec at 2 months (infant series).

group.title: 13vPnC Dose 2
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with a combination vaccine Infanrix hexa and Meningitec at 4 months (infant series).

group.title: 7vPnC Dose 2
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with a combination vaccine Infanrix hexa and Meningitec at 4 months (infant series).

group.title: 13vPnC Dose 3
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 6 months (infant series).

group.title: 7vPnC Dose 3
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 6 months (infant series).

group.title: 13vPnC Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix-IPV+Hib and Meningitec at 15 months (toddler dose).

group.title: 7vPnC Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix-IPV+Hib and Meningitec at 15 months (toddler dose).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Local Reactions
measure.description: Local reactions were collected using an electronic diary. Tenderness was scaled as Any (tenderness present); Significant (Sig) (present and interfered with limb movement). Swelling and redness were scaled as Any (swelling or redness present); Mild (0.5 centimeters [cm] to 2.0 cm); Moderate (Mod) (2.5 to 7.0 cm); Severe (>7.0 cm). Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.
measure.population: The safety population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of vaccine, (n) = number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Systemic Events
outcome.description: Systemic events (fever [Fv] ≥ 37.5 degrees Celsius [C], fever ≥ 38 C but ≤ 39 C, fever >39 C but ≤ 40 C, fever > 40 C, decreased [Decr] appetite, irritability, increased [Incr] sleep, decreased sleep, hives, use of medication [Med] to treat symptoms [sx], and use of medication to prevent symptoms) were reported using an electronic diary. Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.

outcome.population: The safety population included all subjects who received at least 1 dose of vaccine, (n) = number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days.

group.title: 13vPnC Dose 1
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with a combination vaccine Infanrix hexa and Meningitec at 2 months (infant series).

group.title: 7vPnC Dose 1
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with a combination vaccine Infanrix hexa and Meningitec at 2 months (infant series).

group.title: 13vPnC Dose 2
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with a combination vaccine Infanrix hexa and Meningitec at 4 months (infant series).

group.title: 7vPnC Dose 2
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with a combination vaccine Infanrix hexa and Meningitec at 4 months (infant series).

group.title: 13vPnC Dose 3
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 6 months (infant series).

group.title: 7vPnC Dose 3
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 6 months (infant series).

group.title: 13vPnC Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix-IPV+Hib and Meningitec at 15 months (toddler dose).

group.title: 7vPnC Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix-IPV+Hib and Meningitec at 15 months (toddler dose).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Systemic Events
measure.description: Systemic events (fever [Fv] ≥ 37.5 degrees Celsius [C], fever ≥ 38 C but ≤ 39 C, fever >39 C but ≤ 40 C, fever > 40 C, decreased [Decr] appetite, irritability, increased [Incr] sleep, decreased sleep, hives, use of medication [Med] to treat symptoms [sx], and use of medication to prevent symptoms) were reported using an electronic diary. Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.
measure.population: The safety population included all subjects who received at least 1 dose of vaccine, (n) = number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days.

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration (GMC) for Serotype-specific Pneumococcal Immunoglobulin G (IgG) Antibody in 13vPnC Group After the Second Dose and After the Third Dose of a 3-Dose Infant Series and After the Toddler Dose
outcome.description: GMC as measured by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes which are present in both 7vPnC and 13vPnC (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (Serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.
outcome.time_frame: One month after infant series dose 2 (at 5 months of age) and dose 3 (at 7 months of age) and one month after the toddler dose (at 16 months of age)
outcome.population: The evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations; (n) = number of participants with a determinate IgG antibody concentration to the given serotype.

group.title: 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with a combination vaccine Infanrix hexa and Meningitec at 2 and 4 months (infant series).

group.title: 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 6 months (infant series).

group.title: 13vPnC After the Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix-IPV+Hib and Meningitec at 15 months (toddler dose).

measure.title: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration (GMC) for Serotype-specific Pneumococcal Immunoglobulin G (IgG) Antibody in 13vPnC Group After the Second Dose and After the Third Dose of a 3-Dose Infant Series and After the Toddler Dose
measure.description: GMC as measured by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes which are present in both 7vPnC and 13vPnC (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (Serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.
measure.population: The evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations; (n) = number of participants with a determinate IgG antibody concentration to the given serotype.

analysis.groups_desc: For serotype 4, the Geometric Mean fold Rise (GMFR) were calculated using all participants with available data from both 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 and 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3 blood draws.
For serotype 6B the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) was calculated
For serotype 6B, the GMFR were calculated using all participants with available data from both 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 and 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3 blood draws.
For serotype 14, the GMFR were calculated using all participants with available data from both 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 and 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3 blood draws.
For serotype 18C, the GMFR were calculated using all participants with available data from both 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 and 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3 blood draws.
For serotype 19F, the GMFR were calculated using all participants with available data from both 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 and 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3 blood draws.
For serotype 23F, the GMFR were calculated using all participants with available data from both 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 and 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3 blood draws.
For serotype 1, the GMFR were calculated using all participants with available data from both 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 and 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3 blood draws.
For serotype 3, the GMFR were calculated using all participants with available data from both 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 and 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3 blood draws.
For serotype 5, the GMFR were calculated using all participants with available data from both 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 and 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3 blood draws.
For serotype 6A, the GMFR were calculated using all participants with available data from both 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 and 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3 blood draws.
For serotype 7F, the GMFR were calculated using all participants with available data from both 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 and 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3 blood draws.
For serotype 19A, the GMFR were calculated using all participants with available data from both 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 and 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3 blood draws.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Predefined Antibody Levels for Pertussis, Diphtheria, Tetanus, and Poliovirus in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 3-dose Infant Series and the Toddler Dose
outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving predefined antibody threshold levels with the corresponding 95% CI for each concomitant antigen (pertussis antigens including Pertussis Toxoid (PT), Filamentous Haemagglutinin (FHA), and Pertactin (PRN); diphtheria; tetanus; and poliovirus types 1, 2, and 3) are presented.
outcome.time_frame: One month after the 3-dose infant series (7 months of age) and the toddler dose (16 months of age)
outcome.population: The evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

group.title: 13vPnC After Infant Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 6 months (infant series).

group.title: 7vPnC After Infant Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 6 months (infant series).

group.title: 13vPnC After the Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix-IPV+Hib and Meningitec at 15 months (toddler dose).

group.title: 7vPnC After the Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix-IPV+Hib and Meningitec at 15 months.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Predefined Antibody Levels for Pertussis, Diphtheria, Tetanus, and Poliovirus in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 3-dose Infant Series and the Toddler Dose
measure.description: Percentage of participants achieving predefined antibody threshold levels with the corresponding 95% CI for each concomitant antigen (pertussis antigens including Pertussis Toxoid (PT), Filamentous Haemagglutinin (FHA), and Pertactin (PRN); diphtheria; tetanus; and poliovirus types 1, 2, and 3) are presented.
measure.population: The evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

analysis.groups_desc: For Pertussis, PT the difference in percentage between the two groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) at 5.0 EU/mL threshold was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lowest limit of 2-sided 95% CI for the difference between the 2 groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) > -10%.

analysis.groups_desc: For Pertussis, PT the difference in percentage between the two groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) at 20 EU/mL threshold was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lowest limit of 2-sided 95% CI for the difference between the 2 groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) > -10%.

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Titers (GMT) for Poliovirus in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 3-dose Infant Series and the Toddler Dose
outcome.time_frame: One month after the 3-dose infant series (7 months of age) and the toddler dose (16 months of age)
outcome.population: The evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

group.title: 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 6 months (infant series).

group.title: 7vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 6 months (infant series).

group.title: 13vPnC After the Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix-IPV+Hib and Meningitec at 15 months (toddler dose).

group.title: 7vPnC Afte the Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix-IPV+Hib and Meningitec at 15 months (toddler dose).

measure.title: Geometric Mean Titers (GMT) for Poliovirus in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 3-dose Infant Series and the Toddler Dose
measure.population: The evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

analysis.groups_desc: For Poliovirus Type 1 the GMT ratio (13vPnC/7vPnC) was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lower bound of the 2-sided, 95% CI for the GMT ratio (13vPnC group/7vPnC group) was >0.5 (2-fold criterion).

analysis.groups_desc: For Poliovirus Type 2 the GMT ratio (13vPnC/7vPnC) was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lower bound of the 2-sided, 95% CI for the GMT ratio (13vPnC group/7vPnC group) was >0.5 (2-fold criterion).

analysis.groups_desc: For Poliovirus Type 3 the GMT ratio (13vPnC/7vPnC) was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lower bound of the 2-sided, 95% CI for the GMT ratio (13vPnC group/7vPnC group) was >0.5 (2-fold criterion).

analysis.groups_desc: For Poliovirus Type 1 the GMT ratio (13vPnC/7vPnC) was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lower bound of the 2-sided, 95% CI for the GMT ratio (13vPnC group/7vPnC group) was >0.5 (2-fold criterion).

analysis.groups_desc: For Poliovirus Type 2 the GMT ratio (13vPnC/7vPnC) was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lower bound of the 2-sided, 95% CI for the GMT ratio (13vPnC group/7vPnC group) was >0.5 (2-fold criterion).

analysis.groups_desc: For Poliovirus Type 3 the GMT ratio (13vPnC/7vPnC) was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lower bound of the 2-sided, 95% CI for the GMT ratio (13vPnC group/7vPnC group) was >0.5 (2-fold criterion).

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentrations (GMC) for Pertussis in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 3-dose Infant Series and the Toddler Dose
outcome.description: GMCs with the corresponding 95% CI for each concomitant antigen pertussis antigens (PT, FHA, PRN, and FIM) as measured by EU/mL are presented.
outcome.time_frame: One month after the 3-dose infant series (7 months of age) and the toddler dose (16 months of age)
outcome.population: The evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Antibody Level ≥ 0.35 Microgram Per Milliliter (μg/mL) in 13vPnC Group After the Second Dose and After the Third Dose of a 3-Dose Infant Series and After the Toddler Dose
outcome.description: Percentages of participants achieving World Health Organization (WHO) predefined antibody threshold ≥ 0.35μg/mL along with the corresponding 95% CI for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes, present in both 13vPnC and 7vPnC (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.
outcome.time_frame: One month after infant series dose 2 (at 5 months of age) and dose 3 (at 7 months of age) and one month after the toddler dose (at 16 months of age)
outcome.population: The evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

group.title: 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with a combination vaccine Infanrix hexa and Meningitec at 4 months (infant series).

group.title: 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 6 months (infant series).

group.title: 13vPnC After the Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix-IPV+Hib and Meningitec at 15 months (toddler dose).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Antibody Level ≥ 0.35 Microgram Per Milliliter (μg/mL) in 13vPnC Group After the Second Dose and After the Third Dose of a 3-Dose Infant Series and After the Toddler Dose
measure.description: Percentages of participants achieving World Health Organization (WHO) predefined antibody threshold ≥ 0.35μg/mL along with the corresponding 95% CI for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes, present in both 13vPnC and 7vPnC (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.
measure.population: The evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

analysis.groups_desc: For serotype 4, the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 - 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3) was calculated
For serotype 6B, the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 - 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3) was calculated
For serotype 9V, the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 - 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3) was calculated
For serotype 14, the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 - 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3) was calculated
For serotype 18C, the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 - 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3) was calculated
For serotype 19F, the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 - 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3) was calculated
For serotype 23F, the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 - 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3) was calculated
For serotype 1, the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 - 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3) was calculated
For serotype 3, the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 - 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3) was calculated
For serotype 5, the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 - 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3) was calculated
For serotype 6A, the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 - 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3) was calculated
For serotype 7F, the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 - 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3) was calculated
For serotype 19A, the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2 - 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3) was calculated

group.title: 13vPnC Infant Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with a combination vaccine Infanrix hexa and Meningitec at 2 and 4 months, assessment was done approximately one month after dose 2 at 5 months of age.

group.title: 7vPnC Infant Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with a combination vaccine Infanrix hexa and Meningitec at 2 and 4 months, assessment was done approximately one month after dose 2 at 5 months of age.

group.title: 13vPnC Post-Infant Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 6 months (infant series), assessment was done approximately one month after dose 3 at 7 months of age.

group.title: 7vPnC Post-Infant Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at 6 months, assessment was done approximately one month after dose 3 at 7 months of age.

group.title: 13vPnC Toddler Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with MMR II at 12 months. Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix-IPV+Hib and Meningitec at 15 months (toddler dose). Assessment was done approximately one month after toddler dose at 16 months of age.

group.title: 7vPnC Toddler Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with MMR II at 12 months. Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix-IPV+Hib and Meningitec at 15 months (toddler dose). Assessment was done approximately one month after toddler dose at 16 months of age.

group.title: 13vPnC 6-Month Follow-up
group.description: Assessment was done approximately 6 months after 13vPnC toddler dose at 21 months of age.

group.title: 7vPnC 6-Month Follow-up
group.description: Assessment was done approximately 6 months after 7vPnC toddler dose at 21 months of age.

event.description: Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Fever ≥38 degrees C but ≤39 degrees C
Infant Series Dose 2; Fever ≥38 degrees C but ≤39 degrees C
Infant Series Dose 3; Fever ≥38 degrees C but ≤39 degrees C

Infant Series Dose 2; Fever >39 degrees C but ≤40 degrees C
Infant Series Dose 3; Fever >39 degrees C but ≤40 degrees C
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Fever >40 degrees C
Infant Series Dose 2; Fever >40 degrees C
Infant Series Dose 3; Fever >40 degrees C

Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Irritability
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Increased sleep
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Decreased sleep
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Tenderness (any)=present at site of vaccination.
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Tenderness (significant)=present and interfered with limb movement.
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Induration (any)=present at site of vaccination.
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Induration (mild)=0.5 centimeters (cm) to 2.0 cm.
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Induration (moderate)=2.5 cm to 7.0 cm.
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Induration (severe) >7.0 cm.
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Erythema (any)=present at site of vaccination.
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Erythema (mild)=0.5 cm to 2.0 cm.
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Erythema (moderate)=2.5 cm to 7.0 cm.
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Erythema (severe) >7.0 cm.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The PIs agreed to allow the sponsor 60 days to review and require changes to presentations or publications but only to protect confidential information and intellectual property, and for the sponsor to file a patent application, as applicable. The PIs also agreed for data to be presented first as a joint, multi-center publication.
